page.title: 03FARMING IN N.W.HAMPSHIRE.
page.content: Arable crops cover, by far, the largest area in our sector. Winter cereals account for about three- quarters of this area with winter wheat, grown for the milling industry, the largest single crop. Other winter cereals include barley for animal feed and oats for porridge. Spring barley, mainly for the brewing industry, is the only spring cereal. Other arable crops include oilseed rape, peas, beans, maize and lupins, a very new crop to British farming and used for oil. The farmer uses modern machinery to plough and sow and the harvesting is done by combine harvester. The farmer also grows grass for cattle. The one dairy herd, 120 Friesians, graze in the summer but in the winter they are kept inside and fed on silage. Hay is made on the farms in the summer.
